intro: Schkuhria wislizeni f. flava, commonly known as the yellow globemallow, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and the flowers are clustered in spherical inflorescences. It is often found in grasslands and open woodlands, where it contributes to local biodiversity.
